title: Re: favorite lucasarts game
content: Either Grim Fandango or Full Throttle. Both are excellent adventure games.

title: Re: favorite lucasarts game
content:
Never played Full Throtle, but Grim Fandango was obviously great.
I liked Day of the Tentacle a lot, but... right now for some reason I don't get that warm fuzzy memory feeling anymore.
Something I do have with Monkey Island, and the first sequel.
I did play Loom later on, but all in all MI still was more fun for me, it was simply bigger, more complicated.
For now I'd have to conclude MI is my favourite.

Hmmm, The Fate of Atlantis was really nice too though...
I still want to play Full Throttle, and The Dig, someday though.
Actually Zak McKracken as well.Retodon8
You live, you die, you are remembered, you are forgotten. [url=http://keen.retodon8.net/][img]http://retodon8.net/Graphics/Keen_Yorp.gif[/img][/url]

title: hum
content:
Day of the Tentacle, because the use of Leitmotifs for each character, weaved into an overall tapestry of sound, was an impressive part of the musical score. Also, getting Chuck Jones to overlook the artistic direction was fantastic.

I feel like I could... like I could... TAKE ON THE WORLD!
